com.googlecode.aluminumproject.context
Interface Context

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractContext, DefaultContext, ServletContext
public interface Context

A context that is used throughout the processing of one template.

A context can contain variables. Each variable is stored in a certain scope. At the very minimum, implementations are required to support the template scope, though it's possible to add scopes. Scopes that are added can be removed as well.

A context can have a number of implicit objects. Implicit objects are not scoped and can't be replaced. All contexts should have an implicit object named "aluminum" that is a Map<String, Object>. This implicit object shouldn't be used directly, but is meant for internal use only.

When a context supports it, it's possible to create one or more child contexts.

          The name of the implicit object that's used internally.

Method Detail

getScopeNames

Set<String> getScopeNames()
Returns all scope names.

Returns:
a set that contains the names of all scopes in this context

addScope

String addScope(String name,
                boolean requireUniqueName)
                throws ContextException
Adds a scope.

Parameters:
name - the name of the scope to add
requireUniqueName - whether the name is expected to be unique; if it isn't, this context is allowed to change the name to ensure its uniqueness
Returns:
the actual name of the new scope: this will be the same name as was requested if it should be unique, it could be different if a scope with the requested name already exists and the name is not required to be unique
Throws:
ContextException - when the name has to be unique and there already is a scope with the given name

removeScope

void removeScope(String name)
                 throws ContextException
Removes a scope.

Parameters:
name - the name of the scope to remove
Throws:
ContextException - when there's no scope with the given name or when the scope can't be removed

getVariableNames

Set<String> getVariableNames(String scope)
                             throws ContextException
Returns all variable names within a certain scope.

Parameters:
scope - the name of the scope to retrieve the variable names of
Returns:
a set that contains the names of all variables in the given scope (may be empty but not null)
Throws:
ContextException - when there's no scope with the given name

getVariable

Object getVariable(String scope,
                   String name)
                   throws ContextException
Retrieves a variable by name.

Parameters:
scope - the name of the scope to get the variable from
name - the name of the variable to retrieve
Returns:
the value of the variable with the given name in the specified scope
Throws:
ContextException - when there's no scope with the given name or when there's no variable with the given name within the scope

setVariable

Object setVariable(String name,
                   Object value)
Sets a variable in the innermost scope (i.e. the scope that was added last).

Parameters:
name - the name of the variable to set
value - the value to set
Returns:
the previous value of the variable (or null if the variable did not exist)

setVariable

Object setVariable(String scope,
                   String name,
                   Object value)
                   throws ContextException
Sets a variable.

Parameters:
scope - the name of the scope to set the variable in
name - the name of the variable to set
value - the value to set
Returns:
the previous value of the variable (or null if the variable did not exist)
Throws:
ContextException - when there's no scope with the given name

removeVariable

Object removeVariable(String name)
                      throws ContextException
Removes a variable from the innermost scope (i.e. the scope that was added last).

Parameters:
name - the name of the variable to remove
Returns:
the previous value of the variable
Throws:
ContextException - when there's no variable with the given name within the innermost scope

removeVariable

Object removeVariable(String scope,
                      String name)
                      throws ContextException
Removes a variable.

Parameters:
scope - the name of the scope to remove the variable from
name - the name of the variable to remove
Returns:
the previous value of the variable
Throws:
ContextException - when there's no scope with the given name or when there's no variable with the given name within the scope

findVariable

Object findVariable(String name)
                    throws ContextException
Finds a variable across all scopes. When multiple scopes have a variable with the given name, it's up to the context implementation which variable will be returned.

Parameters:
name - the name of the variable to find
Returns:
the value of a variable in one of the scopes with the given name
Throws:
ContextException - when not a single scope contains a variable with the given name

getImplicitObjectNames

Set<String> getImplicitObjectNames()
Returns all implicit object names.

Returns:
a set that contains the names of all implicit objects

getImplicitObject

Object getImplicitObject(String name)
                         throws ContextException
Retrieves a implicit object by name.

Parameters:
name - the name of the implicit object to return
Returns:
the implicit object with the given name
Throws:
ContextException - when no implicit object with the given name exists in this context

createSubcontext

Context createSubcontext()
                         throws ContextException
Creates a child context of this context.

Returns:
the new subcontext
Throws:
ContextException - when this context does not support subcontexts
